name: Diagonal Shoulder Press
how_to_perform:
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
2. Start with the dumbbells at shoulder height, with your palms facing each other and your elbows bent at 90 degrees.
3. Engage your core and keep your chest up as you prepare to press.
4. Rotate your torso slightly to one side while simultaneously pressing the opposite hand up and diagonally across your body.
5. Extend your arm fully overhead on the diagonal path, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
6. Return the dumbbell to shoulder height while bringing your torso back to the starting position.
7. Repeat the movement on the opposite side, rotating your torso to the other side and pressing the other hand diagonally across your body.
8. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
9. Ensure that your movements are controlled, focusing on the shoulders and maintaining balance.
10. Exhale as you press up and inhale as you lower the dumbbell.
short_summary: The Diagonal Shoulder Press is an exercise targeting the shoulders and core, involving pressing a weight diagonally across the body while rotating the torso.
